title: Prague: From Castles to Cash Only
synopsis: If there's one piece of advice you need, it's this: never refuse a shot of Becherovka from a local (but trust us, it's delicious).

title: Old Town Square
synopsis: Start your day here, in the beating heart of Prague.

title: Prague Castle
synopsis: Wander through the largest ancient castle in the world.

title: Lennon Wall
synopsis: A neighbourhood wall covered in Beatles lyrics and ideas of love and peace.

title: Prague Metronome
synopsis: Unveiled in 1991, the metronome replaced an imposing statue of Stalin that had been destroyed 30 years earlier.

title: Charles Bridge
synopsis: Built to connect Prague Castle to Old Town, the bridge is a destination in itself.

title: Dinner at Kantyna
locationKeywords: Kantýna, 1511/5, Politických vězňů, New Town, Prague, okres Hlavní město Praha, Hlavní město Praha, Prague, 1, Czechia
synopsis: A butcher's shop and restaurant in one.

title: Drinks at Cash Only
synopsis: There's more to this bar than meets the eye.

title: Kavarna Novy Svet
synopsis: It's time for a coffee, and where better than in the cobblestone backstreets behind Prague Castle?

title: Strahov Library
synopsis: Within the walls of the Strahov monastery is one of the most stunning libraries you'll ever step into.

title: Hemingway Bar
synopsis: Sister bar to Cash Only, here the order of the day is absinthe, and lots of it.

title: Astronomical Clock
synopsis: Built in 1410 by a local clockmaker, the Prague Orloj is the oldest working clock of its kind in the world.

title: Havelské Tržiště Market
locationKeywords: havelské tržište, Havelská, Old Town, Prague, okres Hlavní město Praha, Hlavní město Praha, Prague, 1, Czechia
synopsis: You can't leave Prague without trying a trdelnik.
